message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CV 

The paper discusses deep reinforcement learning, which is a subfield of machine learning (cs.LG) that involves training agents to make decisions based on rewards. The focus of the paper is on exploring new actions to improve learning, which falls under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also mentions robotic locomotion, which is a subfield of robotics (cs.RO) that involves designing and controlling robots to move in various environments. The use of a forward dynamics model to predict the outcome of actions is a form of system identification (cs.SY), which is a subfield of control theory. Finally, the paper mentions the application of the method to image-based tasks, which suggests a connection to computer vision (cs.CV).
